@@ -0,0 +1,168 @@ + + + + + + Building + Apache Syncope Documentation Team + + + +
+ + + +
+ +
+

+

    +
  • Java 1.6.23 or higher
    • +
  • + Apache Maven 3.0.3 or higher
    • +
  • + Latest source code +
    • +
+

+
+ +
+

+ Before building Syncope, you need to setup an environment variable to give Maven more memory.
+ On Unix + export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xms512m -Xmx1024m -XX:PermSize=256m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" + On Windows + set MAVEN_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx1024m -XX:PermSize=256m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m +

+

+ To build Syncope simply execute (from within the check-out directory): + $ mvn install + or + $ mvn clean install + for subsequent runs.
+ To build Syncope without running any test do: + $ mvn -PskipTests + Important: For subsequent builds (e.g., after code changes are made), + run mvn clean first to build from scratch, before using one of the mvn install + commands above. + (You may also wish to run svn update after running mvn clean but before running + mvn install.) +

+
+ +
+

+ Besides default, other Maven + build profiles are + provided, for developer convenience.
+ Such profiles are limited to a specific module, hence Maven needs to be invoked from the corresponding + subdirectory, not from top-level. +

+ +

Debug

+ Starts the full environment used by integration tests (with same components available when running new project + in embedded mode + but console) and enables remote JPDA debugging on port 8000 in the running JEE container (Tomcat). + $ mvn -Pdebug + +

Dev

+ Run all / some / single integration tests (but no unit tests) by empowering + Maven Failsafe plugin's + selection features: + $ mvn -Pdev +$ mvn -Pdev -Dit.test=UserTestITCase +$ mvn -Pdev -Dit.test=UserTestITCase#create + +

NoOpWorkflow

+ Run the whole test suite by selecting the NoOp workflow adapter implementation; + by default, Activiti is configured instead. + $ mvn -Pnoopworkflow + +

DBMSes

+ +
PostgreSQL
+ After providing connection information in src/test/resources/postgres/persistence.properties, + perform the full test suite against a real PostgreSQL database via + $ mvn -Ppostgres-it + +
MySQL
+ After providing connection information in src/test/resources/mysql/persistence.properties, + perform the full test suite against a real MySQL or + MariaDB database via + $ mvn -Pmysql-it + +
Oracle database
+ After providing connection information in src/test/resources/oracle/persistence.properties + and having + set up the appropriate JDBC driver in your local Maven repository, perform the full test suite + against a real Oracle database via + $ mvn -Poracle-it + +
MS SQL Server
+ After providing connection information in src/test/resources/sqlserver/persistence.properties + and having + set up the appropriate JDBC driver in your local Maven repository, perform the full test suite + against a real MS SQL Server database via + $ mvn -Psqlserver-it + +

JEE containers

+ +
Glassfish
+ Perform the full test suite by deploying Syncope core in + Glassfish via + $ mvn -Pglassfish-it + +
JBoss AS
+ Perform the full test suite by deploying Syncope core in + JBoss AS via + $ mvn -Pjboss-it + +
Oracle WebLogic
+ Either put local WebLogic installation under /opt/weblogic-12.1.1 or + pass -Dweblogic.home=..., then perform the full test suite by deploying Syncope core in + Oracle WebLogic via + $ mvn -Pweblogic-it + + + +

Debug

+ Starts the full environment used by core's integration tests (with same components available when running new project + in embedded mode, + including console) and enables remote JPDA debugging on port 8000 in the running JEE container (Tomcat). + $ mvn -Pdebug + +

JRebel

+ Starts the full environment used by core's integration tests (with same components available when running new project + in embedded mode, + including console) and enables JRebel. + export REBEL_HOME=/opt/jrebel +$ mvn -Pjrebel + +

Selenium

+ Perform the integration test suite based on Selenium; also supports + test selection. + $ mvn -Pselenium +$ mvn -Pselenium -Dit.test=UserTestITCase + +
